title: Urban Furniture Delivery and Pickup Service
content: A furniture retailer operates from multiple regional warehouses (<loc_depot>) to serve customers across cities. Each day, they must deliver new furniture (linehaul: <demand_linehaul>) to households and collect old furniture for recycling (backhaul: <demand_backhaul>). Trucks with a <capacity> kg capacity must first complete deliveries before pickups. Customers have specific service windows (<time_windows>), and drivers cannot exceed an 8-hour shift (<time_limit>). The goal is to minimize total travel distance while ensuring all deliveries and pickups are completed on time without overloading vehicles. Routes can end at any location, reducing unnecessary backtracking to depots.

title: Regional Recycling and Delivery Network
content: A recycling company uses multiple collection centers (<loc_depot>) to distribute empty recycling bins (<demand_linehaul>) to businesses and collect filled ones (<demand_backhaul>). Each vehicle (<capacity> kg capacity) must first deliver bins before hauling waste. Businesses operate within strict hours (<time_windows>), and routes must finish within a 6-hour window (<time_limit>). The challenge is to balance depot workloads, adhere to time constraints, and maximize efficiency while avoiding overloading trucks.

content: A healthcare logistics firm manages multiple medical supply depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver medical devices (<demand_linehaul>) to hospitals and collect outdated equipment (<demand_backhaul>). content: An online retailer uses `<loc_depot>` warehouses to deliver new gadgets to customers `<loc_customer>` while collecting returned devices for recycling. content: A healthcare logistics company operates from multiple regional depots (MD) to deliver medical equipment (e.g., ventilators, diagnostic tools) to hospitals (linehaul customers) and collect biohazardous waste (backhaul) from the same facilities. Vehicles must first complete all deliveries (linehaul) before pickups (backhaul), adhering to strict time windows (TW) for equipment deployment and waste collection mandated by health regulations. Routes must stay within legally imposed driver shift limits (L) and cannot exceed vehicle capacity constraints (C) for both equipment and waste loads. Routes originate from but do not return to their starting depot (O), concluding at the final waste collection point to minimize turnaround times.

title: Seasonal Festival Infrastructure Redistribution with Event Time Windows
content: A festival organizer uses multiple regional depots (MD) to deploy temporary infrastructure (e.g., stages, seating) to event venues (linehaul customers) and later retrieve the equipment (backhaul) for storage. Vehicles must first deliver all items before pickups (B), aligning with venue-specific time windows (TW) for setup and teardown. Routes must stay within event schedule durations (L) and respect payload limits (C) for both deployment and retrieval loads. Starting from depots (MD), routes conclude at the last cleanup site (O), ensuring minimal downtime between events.

title: Agricultural Drone Delivery and Crop Residue Collection
content: A precision agriculture firm operates drone fleets from multiple depots (MD) to deliver seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides (linehaul) to farm fields (linehaul customers) and collect crop residues (backhaul) for biofuel processing. Drones must first complete all deliveries before pickups (B), within planting and harvesting time windows (TW) dictated by seasonal cycles. Flight routes must stay within battery life limits (L) and adhere to payload capacities (C) for both supplies and waste. title: Medical Oxygen Cylinder Redistribution with Empty Cylinder Pickup
content: A medical gas supplier operates from multiple regional depots (MD) to deliver oxygen cylinders to hospitals and clinics (linehaul customers) and collect empty cylinders (backhaul) for refilling. title: High-Tech Manufacturing Component Redistribution with Regional Facilities
content: A semiconductor manufacturer uses multiple regional warehouses (MD) to deliver precision components (linehaul) to assembly plants (linehaul customers) and collect defective parts (backhaul) for recycling. title: Urban Drone Courier Network with Time-Sensitive Deliveries and Battery Swaps
content: A city operates a network of drone hubs (multi-depot locations `<loc_depot>`) to deliver urgent medical supplies to hospitals and collect medical waste for disposal. Each drone has a limited cargo capacity (`<capacity>`) and must adhere to strict time windows (`<TW>`) for hospital deliveries, as some medications require immediate administration. After delivering linehaul items (supplies), drones must return to designated battery swap depots to recharge, but their total flight duration (`<L>`) is constrained by battery life. Backhaul pickups (waste) can only occur after completing deliveries, ensuring waste containers don’t exceed drone capacity. Routes must originate from any depot but can terminate at a different depot to balance workload across hubs.

title: Event Venue Equipment Deployment and Post-Event Recovery
content: A temporary festival requires rapid setup and teardown across multiple regional locations (`<loc_customer>`), managed from three logistics hubs (`<loc_depot>`). Each truck has a `<capacity>` limit for equipment, and routes must respect duration limits (`<L>`) to align with crew shift schedules. Open routes allow vehicles to end at collection depots different from their origin, streamlining recovery logistics while minimizing total travel distance.

title: Electric Vehicle Battery Exchange Logistics Network
content: An EV charging network uses multi-depot battery hubs (`<loc_depot>`) to supply charged batteries (`<demand_linehaul>`) to stations and collect depleted ones (`<demand_backhaul>`). Time windows (`<TW>`) ensure stations receive fresh batteries during peak demand hours, while duration limits (`<L>`) prevent drivers from exceeding 8-hour shifts. Routes are open-ended, ending at any depot to optimize battery redistribution across regions without requiring return trips to origin hubs.

title: Urban Agriculture Hydroponic Supply and Harvest Logistics
content: A network of urban vertical farms (`<loc_customer>`) relies on multi-depot distribution centers (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver hydroponic nutrients (`<demand_linehaul>`) and collect harvested produce (`<demand_backhaul>`). Each truck’s capacity (`<capacity>`) must accommodate both supplies and crates, with duration limits (`<L>`) ensuring drivers finish routes before farm operations resume. title: Airport Terminal Maintenance and Asset Redistribution
content: Airport maintenance crews (`<loc_depot>` hubs) deploy trucks to deliver cleaning supplies (`<demand_linehaul>`) to terminals and collect waste/recyclables (`<demand_backhaul>`) afterward. Strict time windows (`<TW>`) align with flight schedules, requiring supplies to arrive before peak activity. Trucks must avoid overloading (`<capacity>`) and complete routes within shift duration limits (`<L>`). Routes are open-ended to end at satellite depots, enabling efficient asset redistribution while minimizing disruptions to terminal operations. title: Port Container Redistribution and Empty Retrieval Network
content: A port authority operates multiple container depots (MD) across a harbor. The challenge is to optimize routes so trucks end at the last terminal stop without returning to depots (O), minimizing total distance while respecting all constraints.

title: Blood Bank Distribution and Plasma Donation Pickup
content: A network of regional blood banks (MD) dispatches refrigerated trucks to deliver life-saving blood units (linehaul) to hospitals within strict time windows (TW) for urgent surgeries. content: A renewable energy firm uses `<loc_depot>` regional hubs to deliver solar panels and mounting hardware (`<demand_linehaul>`) to rural communities while retrieving decommissioned panels (`<demand_backhaul>`) for recycling. title: Event Stage Infrastructure Redistribution Network

title: Urban Food Truck Supply and Equipment Retrieval Network

title: Event Tent Rental Deployment and Retrieval with Regional Depots
content: A tent rental company operates from three regional warehouses (<loc_depot>) to deploy event tents to festival sites (<loc_customer>). title: Medical Trial Supply Distribution and Sample Collection
content: Pharmaceutical researchers use multiple clinical trial centers (<loc_depot>) to distribute temperature-sensitive medication (<demand_linehaul>) to testing sites (<loc_customer>). title: Offshore Wind Farm Maintenance Logistics
content: A renewable energy firm deploys technicians from coastal depots (<loc_depot>) to offshore wind turbines (<loc_customer>). title: Temporary Storage Container Delivery and Collection for Construction Projects
content: A construction firm uses regional container depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver storage units (<demand_linehaul>) to active sites (<loc_customer>) and later collect them post-construction (<demand_backhaul>).
